snippet: Hong Kong police on Thursday filed manslaughter charges against the captains of two boats that collided in October in the city’s deadliest maritime disaster in more than four decades.
abstract: Hong Kong police file manslaughter charges against Chow Chi-wai and Lai Sai-ming, captains of two boats that collided off Lamma Island in October, accident that took lives of 39 people in city’s deadliest maritime disaster in more than four decades.
lead_paragraph: Hong Kong police on Thursday filed manslaughter charges against the captains of two boats that collided in October in the city’s deadliest maritime disaster in more than four decades.

headline.seo: Captains Charged Fatal in Hong Kong Boat Collision
headline.main: Captains Charged in Hong Kong Boat Collision That Killed 39
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong: Captains Charged in Deadly Boat Collision
